intro: Kermadecia lutea, commonly known as the yellow kermadecia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in coastal areas and is often found in scrub or shrubland habitats. Kermadecia lutea is well adapted to the harsh conditions of its native environment, including strong winds and salt spray.
